data.title: Talent – WNTI Radio – Centenary University
data.text:
Evan Flick is a freshman in the musical theater major. His radio show is called Geek Talk, where he would talk about anything and everything a person would geek out about. He believes that if a person is passionate about any topic, that they are a geek. Also if Evan doesn’t know about the topic […]

Hi, I’m thrilled to be back at WNTI after first coming by in the late 90s then doing my show Rock-it Science from Feb 2002 until Oct 15 2015. I then spent two years on the air at WFDU in Teaneck NJ until August 2017. I have always enjoyed live music and have been going […]

On a summer day at Raceway Park in Englishtown, NJ the Grateful Dead, Marshall Tucker Band, and New Riders of the Purple Sage took the stage and forever secured another music fan. The concert attracted over 150,000 attendees, made the front page of The Star Ledger, and produced a CD: Dick’s Picks, Volume 15. For […]

When Ben Goldman is not busy being an online graduate student studying leadership at Centenary University while working fulltime, he is often listening to a wide variety of music. With a passion for content creation and voiceover, Ben was previously a radio DJ at Ramapo College while earning his bachelor’s in communications, and is currently […]

Colton is a first-year student at Centenary University, pursuing a career in education as a high school math teacher. As far as music interests, Colton has little preference in music and will listen to songs across multiple genres. He has known Dylan since middle school and was invited onto this project because of his enthusiasm […]

Dylan is a freshman at Centenary University and is currently working towards a degree in psychology. He began his interest in music with New Orleans-style jazz and has had a passing or continuous interest in most other genres of music since then. He came up with the idea for Ecliptic Grooves because of his love […]

Carly is a student at Centenary University. She has had an interest in music from her early years and plays electric guitar. Her particular interest is rock music and especially The Beatles. The rock music of the 60s, 70s, and 80s are her favorites. Carly’s audio skills include editing audio software and deejaying. She hopes her […]

Jeff Rusch resides in White Twp with his wife Sandi. He has 4 beautiful children, 2 boys and 2 girls, ranging in age from 31 to 39. He is a retired automotive technician and currently enjoys his passion for buying and selling antiques and Collectibles. Jeff was with WNTI from 2000 to 2015, and eventually […]

Greg Jones is a community volunteer who hosts The Buzzer on WNTI. Greg is in tune with the Northern New Jersey music scene for over several decades.

Garrett is a student at Centenary University. In addition to being the station’s Production Director, Garrett hosts the Around the Pitch show.

Carolyn “Charlie” Stoner is a transfer senior at Centenary University working towards her degree in Secondary English Education. She has a passion for all kinds of music: from classic rock to indie pop to doo-wop, there isn’t a single genre that she doesn’t enjoy. On WNTI Radio, she is the host of “Charlie’s Garage,” a […]

Since 1994, Chris Thomas has been working in and around radio. He's covered US Presidents, NHL Stanley Cup Finals and worked for companies such as Disney and Clear Channel Communications (now iHeartRadio). But he is most passionate about using the power of radio to connect listeners far and wide through our universal love of music on World Pop Radio​.

Lulu Gascoigne was born and raised near London, England. She was “constantly surrounded” by music from a very young age and recalls one of her first memories as choreographing a dance routine to the first record she ever bought (“Crazy Horses” by the Osmonds) in her living room at the grand old age of 5. […]

In 1975 he was the first DJ in Morris County, New Jersey to host an “oldies” night at Smiles in Parsippany. In 1985, he also established the New York Metro area’s first fully professional party jukebox rental service “The Duke of Jukes” – now trading as “PARTY JUKES®”. Gup’s radio career began on WNTI in […]

As a kid growing up in the 60’s I dreamed of getting rich and owning a radio station. From the early days of going into NYC to Sam Goody’s (then one store) and buying 50 albums at a time, I always loved turning people on to new music. Since then I’ve been building my library, attending […]

Mr. Longo teaches Accounting and Finance in Centenary’s School of Professional Studies at both the graduate and undergraduate levels. Prior to coming aboard as a full-time faculty member in 2012, he served as an adjunct instructor at Centenary from 2008 to 2012 and was awarded the Adjunct Excellence Award in 2011. Mr. Longo has an […]

Francis Gavin has his A.B.. in Latin and Ancient Greek from The University of Pennsylvania. He has earned his J.D. from Seton Hall University Law School as well as an L.L.M. in Taxation from New York University. He has over 25 years of public service, serving as the Allamuchy Township Mayor for six years and on […]

Dr. Tim Frederiks has his B.S. in Mathematics Education and MA in Educational Media from Seton Hall University. In addition, he has earned his Ed.S. and Ed.D. in Leadership from Seton Hall, with research concentrations in Professional Development for Teachers and the Use of Programmed Instructional Technology. He has over 35 years of public school […]

Brian Kathenes is a professional appraiser, radio talk-show host and TV personality. He is the co-host of “Value This! with Brian and Leon,” WNTI’s weekly call-in antiques and collectibles talk show. He and his business partner, Leon Castner, share antique tips, take listeners’ calls, and answer questions on all types of antiques and collectibles. Brian […]

Leon Castner has been an appraiser for over thirty years. He grew up in the auction business in northern New Jersey and worked as runner, cashier, trucker, auction manager, and eventually president and chief auctioneer. Leon served as President of The New Jersey State Society of Auctioneers and was named Auctioneer of the Year. His […]
